WRITING.TITLE: Anybody else go to Marvelous NYE this weekend? I got to meet my childhood idols, The Animaniacs and Pinky and the Brain! Hopefully this will be another Con to look forward to next year.

WRITING.TEXT: Im just saying there are a LOT of pics of this kid out and about and not any of the other cast. They started filming not too long ago so I doubt they are done with season 2. If he is out bowling and being photographed enjoying some time off then I wouldnt be surprised if our Toothless friend's world has been turned upside down.
Perhaps his character is not in next season as much for one reason or another

They had a Futurama team up (Just Maurice and Tress) but why do that when I you can get everyone from pretty much every cartoon?
From memory: Rob Paulsen - Yakko, Pinky, Rafael from old TMNT and Donatello from new, Mighty Max, voices on The Boondocks, old chained up guy in El Superbeasto, the mascot in Rick and Morty Anatomy Park and coned nipple person in Unity episode, etc.
Jess Harnell - Wakko, Captain Hero, one of the Transformers (I believe Starscream), the bear on The Cleveland Show after Seth stopped playing him, Rick and Morty Anatomy Park episode he was the other guy in the body, he is a very talented singer in Rock Sugar,
Tress Macneille - Dot and pretty much every other woman voice in cartoons. Seriously.
Maurice LaMarche - The Brain, Kif, Calculon, Abradolf Lincler, Orsen Wells, Im pretty sure you can hear him on Lexus commercials, etc.
These four people have been there with us every since we were kids.
I second that recommendation.

They walked up to random people waiting in line. I will use their character names and not their real names to make it easier and because they were using their cartoon voices a majority of the time. Yakko shook everyone's hand. I was standing next to a red headed lady and he walked up to us and said, "Hello, red head! Hello, red hat!" As Yakko was talking to another woman, Wakko ran up behind him and was like, "Alright, give someone else a turn!" Dot and Brain weren't as interactive but just as nice. They said hi to everyone and cracked jokes. When getting the photo, it wasn't rushed like most cons. I shook all their hands, thanked them for my childhood, gave them the Pops and told them, "It's so my mom can identify you". They had never seen them in person, from their reaction. As I was done, I personally thanked Wakko. I told him I had an older brother and a younger sister. He replied, "Oh, so you know how I feel!" I giggled. Then told him I thought his band Rock Sugar was amazing. He gave me a fistbump. Ive met a few celebs at past cons. This was the best, by far.
I have an older brother and a younger sister. I told Jess i was the middle child and in Wakko's voice he said "so you know how I feel". My childhood was so happy with that.
They are here til Sunday. Tomorrow they have a Q A/panel.
Dallas.
Yes he is. I told him i loved his album and he gave me a fist bump. He was also Captain Hero on Drawn Together.
That guy in the middle....he's pretty cool.

Thank you. They had never seen them before. I also brought them so my mom can identify them in her picture I gave her. These guys were my second parents. I passed social studies because of their songs. I have never smiled that big and that genuine in my life.

WRITING.TITLE: My buddy just tried to pass the blunt to his dog [8 but he's at a 10]
WRITING.TEXT: Im on the couch and the dog is next to me. My buddy is pacing while talking about what to get his wife for Xmas. Half way through the B, after his turn, he walks over to the dog and tries to pass it to him. For like a good 4 seconds. The dog and I had the same look of confusion. As soon as he realized it, he sat back down and we had a real good laugh. Dog is still confused though.

WRITING.TITLE: TIFU by turning a gas station bathroom into what looked like a crime scene
WRITING.TEXT: I was walking into a gas station and I stepped on a broken bottle. Not really ON it but it sliced the side of my toe (wearing flip flops) enough to cause a bit of bleeding. I make it inside, grab a few napkins and soak up most of the blood. After waiting my turn in line I ask the old lady behind the counter if she has a band aid because I had just stepped on glass in the parking lot. She asked me if I was wearing shoes. I hobble to the bathroom. On one wall and corner, I have the sink with soap dispenser. On the other wall and corner is the toilet paper dispenser. The first two minutes was me going back and forth, bleeding on the floor, trying to clean my wound enough to put a band aid on and get home to clean it up better. After several trips from sink to toilet paper, I had the bright idea to just grab a bunch of toilet paper and then lean against the sink near the soap dispenser. After finally getting enough soap on my foot, I attempt to put on the band aid and then...FWOMP! I rip the sink right out of the wall and onto the floor. It's not gushing out water, but it is no longer attached and sitting up straight. The bathroom looked like a small crime scene into which someone was violently thrown into the sink and bled all over the ground. I panicked...and left. I feel bad for not saying anything to the old lady working there. There was another line, longer than before, and I didn't feel like leaving more DNA at the scene of the crime. I might go back to that gas station someday and confess. I need to start wearing actual shoes again.
